issue.title: ime_spot set incorrectly on high DPI displays
issue.body:
Linux (Fedora 29), X11

When using a high DPI display the IME input position isn't scaled by the DPI, so at 150% DPI my IME's preview window is 50% further from the origin on both axes.

![2019-02-01_21-21-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1551320/52160542-3f30d880-266c-11e9-931d-7f6e44972042.png)

rename.from: Mac input method select list position is not correct.
rename.to: Input method select list position is not correct

body: Note this is not macOS-specific, but has been reproduced on Linux in #2061.

body: @chrisduerr Why not update ime position after redraw?

Redrawing shouldn't do anything special to mutate the terminal state.

If my patch doesn't work though, feel free to try that too.

@chrisduerr That patch does not fix the issue for me, the IME position is unchanged.

I quickly fixed it for myself by dividing nspot_x and nspot_y in update_ime_position by hidpi_factor.

Not taking DPI into account, sounds like a very likely cause for this problem! Thanks for looking into this @awused, unfortunately I'm completely unfamiliar with IME.

Would you mind sending a PR? I'll gladly help out with style or other issues if there still are some.
@chrisduerr , @awused 's PR code works fine for me.
